dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S914 PCS: To amend title 31, United States Code, to clarify the use of credentials by enrolled agents.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Hatch, from the Committee on Finance, reported the following original bill; which was read twice and placed on the calendar

form.official-title: To amend title 31, United States Code, to clarify the use of credentials by enrolled agents.

section.text: Section 330 of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (b), (c), and (d) as subsections (c), (d), and (e), respectively, and
by inserting after subsection (a) the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Any enrolled agents properly licensed to practice as required under rules promulgated under subsection (a) shall be allowed to use the credentials or designation of enrolled agent, EA, or E.A..

endorsement.action-desc: Read twice and placed on the calendar
